author: Corinne Ramey
title: Ex-Brooklyn D.A. Hit With Conflict-of-Interest Fine
text:
New York Cityâ€™s Conflicts of Interest Board said Tuesday it had imposed the largest fine related to campaign activities in its 28-year history on former longtime Brooklyn District Attorney Charles Hynes for using city resources for his failed 2013 re-election bid.
In addition to paying a $40,000 fine, Mr. Hynes, a Democrat who served as district attorney from 1990 through 2013, admitted to using his work computer and email address for campaign-related business.
...
